clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of OxyVu for Assessing Level of Amputation With Comparison to Other Modalities
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Validation of HyperMed OxyVu Tissue Oximeter for Assessing Level of Amputation With Comparison to Other Modalities

collaborator.agency: Carl T. Hayden VA Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: Correlation of(OxyVu) values to to ABI, TBP, and TCOM in patients scheduled for foot level amputation because of critical limb ischemia, infection, or tissue necrosis.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to correlate tissue oxygenation values measured with a hyperspectral imaging system (OxyVu) to Ankle Brachial Indices (ABI), toe pressures (TBP), and transcutaneous oxygen monitoring (TCOM) in patients scheduled for foot level amputation because of critical limb ischemia, infection, or tissue necrosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess predictive value for healing by 8 weeks of OxyVu, ABI, TBI and TCOM measured prior to amputation. OxyVu readings for oxyhemoglobin, deoxyhemoglobin and oxygen saturation will be compared to healing potential predicted from ABI, TBI, and TCOM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect additional interventions required through review of patient medical records at 12 months

study_pop.textblock: 18 to 85 years of age, males and females, varying skin tones, varying racial origins, and with and without diabetes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 85 years of age, males and females, varying skin tones, varying racial origins, and with and without diabetes.
- Patients scheduled for foot level amputation because of critical limb ischemia, infection, or tissue necrosis.
